snippet: The group sought to distance itself from an article on its website that called brandishing weapons in public in support of open-carry laws “scary” and “weird.”
abstract: National Rifle Association is distancing itself from article on its website calling demonstrations by gun rights advocates who brandish weapons in public, in states with open carry laws, 'scary,' saying such protests cross line into 'downright foolishness'; article and denunciations are unusual public disagreement inside NRA about the tactics of protesters.
lead_paragraph: The group sought to distance itself from an article on its website that called brandishing weapons in public in support of open-carry laws “scary” and “weird.”

headline.main: N.R.A. Backs Away From Article Criticizing Advocates of Carrying Guns in Public
headline.print_headline: Rifle Group Backs Away from Article on Its Site
